optimal_care.description: Clean surface burners after spills, ensuring burner ports and electrodes remain unobstructed
Use appropriate cleaning method for oven interior - manual cleaning, steam clean, or self-clean based on soil level
Keep oven vents and air openings clear for proper airflow
Maintain griddle by cleaning after each use and keeping it properly seasoned
Regular inspection and cleaning of oven door gasket and glass
Check and ensure burner caps are properly seated for optimal flame performance
Keep oven racks clean and lubricated with vegetable oil if sliding becomes difficult

support.description: Visit GEAppliances.com/service for online service scheduling
Call 800.432.2737 for general support during business hours
Register product at GEAppliances.com/register for enhanced service

safety.description: Never use for space heating - risk of carbon monoxide poisoning
Keep flammable materials away from cooktop and oven
Verify anti-tip bracket is properly installed and engaged
Prevent children from accessing appliance during operation
Never leave surface burners unattended while cooking

cleaning.description: Mild soap and water solution for general cleaning
Vinegar and water solution for stubborn stains
Bar Keepers Friend Soft Cleanser for stainless steel surfaces
CitruShine Stainless Steel Wipes for exterior surfaces
Hot, soapy water for burner components - avoid steel wool

maintenance.description: Daily: Clean spills and splatters after each use
Monthly: Deep clean burners and grates
As needed: Run self-clean cycle when oven is heavily soiled
Annually: Professional inspection of gas and electrical systems recommended
